Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, close to metro and the center”
Reviews.Author: mikesk8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located around 20min walking from Brandenburg Gate. My room was rather small, especially comparing to the bathroom; clean but 80s style. There was no free internet included in the room price. The breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: London09
Reviews.Content: For the cheap price (compared to other Berlin hotels) €52 for a single room - I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room. Very clean hotel, good room size (it was a double not single). Bistro and bar attached to hotel serving really nice food. Breakfast overpriced so avoided that. 1 minute from the Gleisdreieck U-bahn station which takes you to Potsdamer Platz in only a few minutes, so location cannot be faulted. Someone commented on the industrial look to the area immediately around the hotel, yes it is true it won't win any awards for beautiful views but the cheap price and convenient location more than make up for it. If not there is are hotels €20 more nearer Potsdamer Platz. The only reason this doesn't get 5* is because a couple of the girls in the bar were a bit frosty!

Reviews.Title: “Gleisdreieck”
Reviews.Author: Trvlmnky33
Reviews.Content: For me, the best and worst thing about this hotel was the location, just 30 Metres from the U1/U2 Gleidsdreieck station but in a street with an industrial feel.............. although just round the corner is the Tech Museum and a park............. In the UK, I'd expect an upscale hotel from the Mercure brand. This isn't though, it is more Ibis than Mercure. My room was very clean and tidy but I was only provided with a single Duvet/Quilt for the double bed! The best they could offer was another single duvet as there seemed to be a shortage of double duvets............ Would I recommend? Not really............... perhaps tainted a little by the 'duvet debacle'!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mercure while visiting Berlin. It is very close to the U Bahn station, maybe too close as you can really hear the trains but we enjoyed it closenest anyway! The breakfast was very good with tons of choices, however at 16 euros per person I thought it was a little steep, especially if you don't feel like taking that big breakfast before heading out the door. The staff was very cordial and made sure everything was in good order so we could enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel in a quiet neighborhood. Although located slightly off from the main city center it still has a very good location. With a U-Bahn station serviced by 2 lines just 100 meters away from the hotel, you reach the city center, the cental parts of the former West Berlin as well as the former East Berlin center in less than 10 minutes. Very good breakfast buffé served in a nice breakfast room or on the silent inner court yard. Good value for money and well worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: xeraxia
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the friendliest, most helpful staff, along with a great area. It was my partner's 30th birthday and without asking, they left a lovely gift in our room with a card. Definitely wouldn't have expected that for a 3 star. We will definitely return to stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: susiegr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights for sightseeing in Berlin. The first room I was allocated was hot and smelled of cigarette smoke but on request I was immediately moved to a non smoking room with AC. Staff were always courteous and helpful. Breakfast in room for no extra charge was superb and there was enough food to last all day! Location is great, I didn't need to use the underground at all, it was only about 10 ins walk to Potsdamer platz and about 20 mins to Brandenburg gate. If you don't like walking there are plenty of buses and trains to all locations. A taxi to the main station was only 9 euros I had a great stay here, I agree with other reviewers about area but there are a couple of good bars and restaurants fairly close, stresseman cafe was excellent also mexican restaurant both only 5 mins from Hotel.As a single female traveller I did feel a little bit scared when walking back late one night to the Hotel because the area isn't too well lit and feels deserted at night, however I had no problems at all and I think its just the perception you get of the area. Work at the station during the day did not disturb me at all. . Wifi is available but you do pay extra for it, I did have to ask every day for a breakfast menu for ordering in rooIm. In Berling I really reccommend the Jewish Museum and the city bus tour. And don't forget if you want to visit the reichstag you have to register online at least 2 days before your visit, you can do it from their website, lots of people were getting disappointed because they didn't know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff. Very important!”
Reviews.Author: teebee1984
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the seemingly poor location, the street it is in is quite shabby. Once you have your bearings everything is within easy reach. Brandenburg Tor (gate) is 15/20 minutes walk. The Anhalter Bahnhof raiway is 5 minutes away and you can reach all parts of Berlin from there for just around 6.5 Euros for a day travel ticket which covers the buses and uBahn too. The hotel itself is really lovely, the staff are friendly and helpful which is so important when you are alone , as I was, in a strange city. They speak very good English and if you need a taxi, one will arrive within 5 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants on the Willhelmstrasse again within easy reach. My room was clean well and maintained, I would not hesitate to book here again. I didn't have the breakfast in the hotel I was too eager to explore this fascintaing city!.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: katnjim
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the beginning of April, the hotel itself is spotlessly clean, although the rooms are small they are comfortable and pleasantly decorated. We didn't opt for breakfast as we felt this was overpriced but there were plenty of cafe's in Wittenbergplatz and Postdamer Platz serving well priced breakfasts, There is nothing near the hotel itself except for a garage where we would pick up water and snacks, and of the course the tube, for location it is ideally located on the U1 and U2 line, which can get you the the main places of Berlin within minutes. Berlin itself is a beautiful city, and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend. Deserves four stars.”
Reviews.Author: Josephien
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews beforehand, I had mixed feeling about my hotel choice for this 5 days trip. Yet when I got there, I knew it'd be perfect. Yes. it is situated in an unusually 'deserted' location but all the better for it. After a day spent in the Berlin buzz, going back to the little island of peace and quiet that is the Gleisdreick Station and around was very welcome. The hotel is located nearly opposite to the station, and is an ideal base to navigate quickly in any direction, being totally central. Ok as with another Mercure I stayed in (Bremen) I can see that there is two sides to the hotel : the bad side, overlooking the station and probably suffering from the trains' racket. The good side, where I was, where you still hear them go by in the distance, but nothing bad at all. In fact, my rating of hotels is always in term of the quiet at night and this one definitely comes at a brilliant First ! I had not slept so well in a long time. Maybe there was low occupancy or the soundproofing is perfect. I also very much appreciated that I had asked for a quiet room and got one. The Accor chain is great for the excellent service it offers yet gives you the option of total anonymity if you wish so. The staff at this Mercure was lovely and extremely helpful. The breakfast, I did not have, as a little too pricey for my apetite in the morning. There is an express version at 5.99 euros. The breakfast room is very nice and there is a pond with fish in the courtyard. All very pleasant. My room was large, great bathroom, all very comfortable with all the little extras that make a difference : complimentary water bottle, tv program etc...There is online access in the hall.. I have stayed in Four stars that did not offer so much (Venice). So there is in my view only one reason this hotel has not got 4 stars but three : the awful orange colour of the carpet everywhere. Change the carpet and it'll be another world ! One last little thing : the cleaning staff should really Not knock on the door at 9 am. as if you'd overslept ! Meant to be a holiday after all !

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Berlin Mitte by Gleisdreieck metro station”
Reviews.Author: SW17LondonPaul Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to get to other places but hotel itself has very little around it so you need to travel elsewhere for anything other than the hotel. 2 regular metro lines within a stone's throw of the hotel linking you to all the key places in Berlin. If arriving via Berlin Brandenburg International Airport (formerly Schoenefeld), it's just a couple of changes via S-Bahn and Metro Line 1 with regular services. No chance of getting cold in your room even when the weather's going down to -15C! Reception staff are very helpful and, very usefully, Berlin day tickets for public transport are available from them; far more reliable than Berlin's BVG ticket machines! I'll probably stay there again and hopefully without the snow that started bringing the whole city to a standstill by the time that I left.

Reviews.Title: “berlin trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like it. no especial comments. keep the prices reasonable Location near U Bahn is essential

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, no frills, great value”
Reviews.Author: mrtrench
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive and very well located near to Checkpoint Charlie and only a short walk from Unter den Linden. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The breakfasts were fantastic. The staff were friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for any more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not on July”
Reviews.Author: Saranna00
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel if you like a quiet night sleep, but also easy access to the u-bahn and nightlife. We stayed in late June and the first night it was unbearably hot, but we got a fan for the rest of the nights and it was alright. I'd stay in this hotel again, but not in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet yet central Area - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_dl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an easter break, overall we thought the hotel was good and was a good combination of price/location/facilities. Very close to a Metro station (almost across the road) - yet very quiet. It is a 5 - 10 minute metro ride to the Potsdamer Platz, and then a 10 minute walk to the Brandenberg gate. Very good front desk staff who were very helpful. Would definitely stay here again. The only thing that would have been nice would have been free wireless internet, as the rates they charge are extortionate!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break”
Reviews.Author: PaulJNottingham
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere and a lovely courtyard. 60 seconds from the U-bahn but we found Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag walkable. Definately would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in no man's land”
Reviews.Author: Austriacus
Reviews.Content: After a two days stay at Mercure Hotel Berlin Mitte I have very little to tell about it because everything is pretty normal and alright there. In other words, this is actually a decent hotel with small but tastefully decorated rooms, comfortable albeit firm beds and good pillows. Apparently it has been completely renovated fairly recently and for the most part it is still in a perfect condition. This was particularly true for the really luxurious bath of my room. For subway users this hotel is ideally situated less than 100 m away from the Gleisdreieck station of U1 and U2. If the room is located on the court-side of the building, the noise of the subway trains, which in fact pass high above the ground here, is nonetheless almost inaudible. However, this might be different for rooms at the exterior front at Luckenwalder Strasse. The buffet breakfast is excellent so that one is always tempted to eat too much. All members of staff I was in contact with were really friendly. The "Keys to Europe" promotion rate is attractively priced for Berlin standards. So are there no drawbacks at all? In my opinion there is one, about which, however, the hotel cannot do anything. It consists in the surroundings of the hotel. They comprise residential buildings, small workshops, office blocks and alike on the one side and an urban wasteland on the other. Thus, it is virtually impossible to find a nice restaurant in walking distance or to buy at least a snack there. The best thing to do in this respect is to flee the area, e.g. by subway. But to someone who is not bothered by that, Mercure Hotel Berlin Mitte can definitely be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, helpful staff, good breakfast buffet,nice rose wine in bar!!!”
Reviews.Author: Womble92
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a single room. It was very clean, comfortable, warm & quiet. Location of hotel wasn't great but a underground station at the corner of the street meant you were not that far away from all the sights of Berlin. The staff were great, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room on floor one”
Reviews.Author: tsangr
Reviews.Content: After check in, I was initially given a room on floor one and it had a bit of an unpleasant smell, not just the room but in the hallway as well. I requested a change and they gave me room on the third floor (3A part) which was nice. We stayed 4 nights. I was on a conference and I took the U-Bahn (U2) which was literally just outside the hotel to its left. Best thing about this hotel is the proximity to the U2 line which is the same line to go to Potsdamer platz and Alexander platz. (also to the convention centre called the ICC to the west). There is a central courtyard in the middle of the hotel where one can sit and have a coffee or drink. However close by, there is nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, great value with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TopBusinessCoach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on business coaching senior executives in a global organsiation so it was important for me to get a good nights sleep. The room was clean and had a respectbale size double bed although design was where the mattress was sunk into the base of the bed. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent english as my German is non-existent. The breakfast was of excellent quallity offereing about 7 different types of bread and cheese. The cooked breakfast was not that great though, but that was ok for me as i only have eggs. The checkout time was 12pm which was great for me as my first meeting was not until 11am. The only negative point was the beer - if you like a good beer dont drink the berliner pilsner - it is really yuk! All in all a god hotel with excellent links to the German underground - it wsa literally across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value, excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: NapsRJ
Reviews.Content: This Mercure hotel is almost inside a subway station. It makes it very convenient. Around the hotel there is not much what to see or why to walk around. Almost 3 blocks away there is a mini market and it you don’t mind walking in 20 minutes you are at Alexander Platz. Having the subway available make you use it even for small distances. The room is clean, renewed, good sized, good bath room, a great choice. The staff is helpful and willing to answer the questions you have and make suggestions. They have a bar in the main floor that is convenient to take a German beer before going to sleep. In case I have the chance to visit Berlin again I would surely stay there once more. I was very pleased with everything in the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very bland, but clean and close to transport”
Reviews.Author: Peccorinos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure but did not know much about Berlin or what was a nice , pictuesque area to stay in. This is not a picturesque area to stay in. The hotel itself was quite reasonable. The rooms were comfortable and clean. However, the reception staff would not speak or greet you unless you directly approached them, and even then, we felt like they didn't really want to offer any help. The hotel is located very close to a subway station, but we didn't hear any noise from the subway. The hotel is not really super close to anything else, including restaurants or shops, and the walk to the shops at night is quite dark and a bit scary. Overall, the hotel would be fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: RBRSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: The street in which the hotel is located is very calm. Underground station is about 100 meters from the front door. I stayed in a room facing the inner garden on the 4th floor. It was very quiet, had a good heating system, good space in the room, nice bathroom. I had dinner in the hotel´s bistrot twice and it was quite good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The only problem I had was with the WiFi Internet connection that was not constant and had many interruptions

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room & Excellent Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mkurozen
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Mercure Hotel Mitte in late August 2008. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and the breakfast (which was included in the price I paid for) was excellent! The location of the hotel is convenient as well; it is a 2 minute walk to the train station and a 15-20 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz. There were no restaurants nearby but this was not a negative for us as we dined near the areas we did sightseeing in. Overall, this hotel was a great value for the money and I would definitely stay here again. Note: There was no airconditioning although it was not a necessity during my stay. My room had a fan and windows which could be opened. My friend's room did not have a fan but the windows could be opened.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: clarelw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mecure Hotel Berlin Mitte 24th July - 27th July. We booked through bookings.com and got a great rate of €59 / night. We didn't have breakfast as it was expensive at €12 each. The hotel was easy to reach from the airport via the airport express and U Bahn, the U Bahn station is across the road from the hotel. Cost of ticket is €2.60 each and the complete journey took about 45 mins from airport to hotel. Public areas of the hotel are very nice and air conditioned and all staff were friendly. There is a courtyard in the middle of the hotel that you can eat breakfast in or have a drink from the bar. It is lovely and quiet just what you need after a day sightseeing in Berlin. The cafe bar / bistro is open from 3pm - 1am. It never seemed very busy whilst we were there. They do serve some food although the choice is limited. We stayed in room 512 on the top (5th floor). The room was a good size and spotlessly clean. The room also had fantastic air conditioning which was definately needed as the temperature was 32oC. There was also a small minibar and room service was available between 5pm - 10pm. Safety deposit boxes are available at reception free of charge. In the luggage room there were also fans and irons / ironing boards that could be borrowed. The bathroom was lovely with a fantastic shower. Lots of shampoo and shower gel provided. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom also. If I was to pick fault then a couple of things that the room could do with are tea / coffee making facilities and a table top mirror for applying make up. Overall i wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again for that price. Although there is nothing around the hotel you are only 2 stops or 10 minute walk from potsdamer platz.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: E_SNorway
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Ordered the stay over the net. Very nice location, 50 metres from a U-Bahn station (Gleisdreieck) and along a quiet street. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel looks very recently refurbished or almost new. Our room had a nice bed, a small desk, a TV with lots of channels and a tiled bathroom. Everything was very clean, and roomkeeping friendly. Breakfast was a bit on the expensive side, but well worth it. Fresh pressed juice, fresh bread and a good selection of ham, cheese, fruits etc. I will definitely check the price next time I'm going to Berlin and stay here one more time if I get a good offer.

Reviews.Title: “I'd be happy to come back”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBarry
Reviews.Content: Wanted to go back to Germany as I had visited other parts before and was impressed. Decided on Berlin because of its historical facts and again I was pleasantly surprised. Initally had help at the train station and everyone continued to be of help and assistance. The hotel is situated next to the underground and is only two stops from the Potsdamme Platz. The Sony Centre is situated here and is a must to see. If you want a walk, it will take you about 15 min. The hotel was very clean and tidy and was exceptional value for money. The staff were helpful and friendly and the bar is open late. Would recommend a guided tour with Berlin Walks [--]. Our guide was very informative and you see and learn all about the city, without wandering round aimlessley. Considering Berlin is a capital, prices round the city are very resonable. All in all another unforgetable trip.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: shwetaLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Berlin and stayed at this hotel which is just two stops on U2 from Zoological Garten. It was well connected and on the whole a comfortable budget hotel. We did not have any meals there as it was easy to go to either Potsdamer Platz or any other central location. It is right next to the Technical Museum too. Bright orange decor, the staff was helpful and the room was comfortable and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tittiDokka
Reviews.Content: Concidering the price we paid when we booked this hotel from at bookingcompany, we got much more than we had hoped for from a 3-star hotel. Our room was spacius, comfortable, quiet and clean. Right outside our room was a little quiet garden with tabeles and chairs. Breakfast was good. The staff were all polite and helpfull. The hotel is situated a few meters from the U-ban that take you to Potsdamer Platz in 7-10 min. Great location to explore the city. We had a day-card that gave us access to all public transport inside Berlin, and used this every day. But we also used bike to get around to the most popular places. Recomend this way to get around, but stay away from rush-hour! Many popular places such as Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburger Tor, Checpoint Carlie are easy to reach from this hotel. The hotels nearest sourroundings are not much, but since the hotel itself is new and cosy, and it is easy to reach all you need by public transport or walking, we diden`t se this as a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Checkpoint Charlie and upgrade shopping”
Reviews.Author: ekievit
Reviews.Content: great hotel next to shopping and "Checkpoint Charlie" service is very good and the rooms are spacious A bit of a side street but near to everything walking distance to "Unter den Linden" 15 min We were delighted about Berlin,great food and a very nice short stay. We paid 98 euro per night for a 5 day stay Great bargain

Reviews.Title: “OK but might not go back”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Booked here for a good value stay. Having used Accor hotels before I didn't expect any issues but mine started when I arrived. Apparently my booking had been changed so that I arrived a day earlier. Just as well I had my email from them which showed that I hadn't! So after much huffing and puffing and a swear word, I got my key. The room was tiny - considering I had booked a room for 1 or 2 people, I was surprised when it only had a single bed! But no problem. To be fair to the hotel, the room was clean and comfortable, bathroom was fine and the range of TV channels was excellent - it includes BBC World which is a better alternative for me than CNN. The room did get very warm and given the current hot weather that Berlin is suffering, I struggled to get a good night's sleep. The double glazing kept out most noise but as the courtyard gets busy first thing in the morning, you couldn't keep the window open overnight for ventilation. No air-con is provided and in the summer it's needed. Breakfast was excellent as were the staff serving here - very friendly and helpful. Gleisdreick U-Bahn has good connections though getting to the main railway station is a bit of a long winded journey. Overall not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cez
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel situated in a quiet location but within 1 min walk to the subway. Bar open til 1am. The staff are really friendly, i asked the barmaid to recommend a nice area to have a meal & she printed off lots of places for us to go. Rooms were nice but the only downside was that they were so hot with no air con - although they did supply a fan. Breakfast ok & would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rennendvosje
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through accorhotels.com. The hotel is located in a very quiet neighbourhood, next to the U-bahn station that will take you to the city center in less than 5-10 minutes. 10 minutes was the longest we had to wait for a train to arrive, so that's perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful, it was no problem to drop off our luggage before going back to the airport, and their english was good. The room was nice, quite a big bathroom with a nice warm shower, and the sleeping part was good as well. The beds were good, there was hardly any noise from outside or inside the hotel. We had a wonderful stay, and if we ever go to Berlin again, we will go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Millns
Reviews.Content: We have used Mecure hotels in Germany before and always get good value and good service and this hotel was no exception The hotel itself is located in a quiet spot, next to a U-Bahn station so acess to the whole city is good. The room was clean and tidy and public areas (bar, breakfast room, courtyard) were comfortable and well decorated. The reception service was very good, helping with tickets and directions, incidentally all staff spoke good English which put my pigeon German to shame. Berlin itself is a very large city, with far too much to see in one weekend, so recomend a bus tour (which the hotel arranged for us) just to get to a taste of what is on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for sleeping, not much more.”
Reviews.Author: bigworldtravelerdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five days during the Berlin Film Festival. It's conveniently located in some aspects- it's just about 60 seconds from a subway stop, and it's only a 10-15 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz. But the amenities leave something to be desired. My room was ok, but very small, and the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. The wireless internet was a disaster, and since I was there on business, I wound up spending a lot of the evening in the lobby, as that was the only place to get a signal. Once 9pm hits, there is nowhere around to get any food- even the gas station on the corner is closed. You're either in a cab or the U-bahn, but if you're going for tourism and not for business, you're probably not going to be sitting at the hotel anyway. The on-premises bistro isn't very good, and only has three options for dinner. The breakfast buffet is OK, but there are generally only three hot items- mildly stale eggs, sausage, and some sort of fried potato or meat dish. There's a good swath of meats and cheeses, though, so you'll be ok. In the end the place is clean, quiet, and generally nice. The staff is helpful, and the rooms are great for the price. But it's a super-sleepy part of town, so don't expect to get far on foot without investing 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Claire-and-Ian
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was concerned about the location before we arrived. Although the area is very quiet with very little nearby, the hotel was actually ideally located. It takes less than a minute to walk to the metro where lines 1 and 2 intersect. These lines take you to all the main tourist sites in Berlin. You can travel West to Charlottenburg (4 stops) and Nollendorfplatz (2 stops) for good places to eat and East to the major tourist sites and more restaurants around the Kreuzberg area. The hotel was clean, spacious and cheap if booked on the internet. Also had no problems extending our stay while we were there and the staff gave us the cheapest rate irrespective of the current price on the internet. Would definitely recommend it for value for money, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: torero94
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Simple, but comfortable. Seemed to be situated in a quiet neighborhood. As mentioned in other reviews, just a short walk to Gleisdreieck subway stop. Not much else nearby. Courtyard and lobby areas are nice places to sit and relax, even though they weren't spacious. Didn't really spend much time in the hotel, as I was exploring the wonderful city, but was able to sleep peacefully. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Gnopps
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel pretty cheap and had a good stay. The hotel isn't located in the absolute center of the city but is very close to the subway. Breakfast was plentiful and tasted good. Only downside was that our room got really hot and couldn't be cooled very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Wyn8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in August 2005. The hotel is located approx 200m from the railway station. It's a fairly new hotel, and the rooms are very modern, with a huge marble bathroom and very comfortable beds. You can't really walk to any restaurants - need to take the u-bahn a few stops. Two issues: for one day the water was brown - the hotel knew about this when we advised them. And we couldn't open the windows at night due to a mosquito plague. I booked the hotel online through a booking agent - there was no problem doing this.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Luckenwalder Strasse 11, 10963 Berlin, Germany
